results.title: Journey into tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Victorian Railways and Fortune Film Productions
results.brief_description: The story of the duplication and electrification of the Gippsland line to Yallourn and Traralgon. Shows its effect on the communities that look to the railway to bring them better living, more goods and greater service, and to take their products swiftly to market.

results.title: The Happy toilers
results.creator_credit: Keith David Smith and Children's Library and Craft Movement
results.brief_description: An amateur record of the efforts by children attending a crafts centre in a migrant hostel to build their own swimming pool. Made at Bradfield Park Housing Settlement and the Lane Cove National Park.

results.title: Half of mankind
results.creator_credit: Ezra Mir, United Nations and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: This film deals with community development in Asia. The village is the unit of organization on which Asia rests, and it is the basis of community development. Three examples are shown: simple self-help in Cambodia; villages cooperating with the World Health Organization to run a health clinic in Afghanistan; interdependence of the agricultural and industrial communities in India, with cash crops providing capital for agricultural development and mechanized expansion of village crafts with the aid of electricity.

results.title: A Half million teenagers
results.brief_description: Studies the physiology aspects of venereal disease. Uses animation to show how the organisms of gonorrhea and syphilis enter and affect the body and how the diseases may be recognised. Stresses the need for treatment, pointing out that there is a cure for both diseases.

results.title: The Greatest game on earth
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, Roland Beckett, Australian National Football Council and Melbourne Repertory Film Unit
results.brief_description: Ricky, who has recently arrived in Australia, sees his first game of Australian Rules Football when he follows the boys of his neighbourhood to the Melbourne Cricket Ground where Geelong is playing Collingwood. At first the atmosphere is strange and new, but the boy soon becomes a part of the enthusiastic crowd excited by the fast field play, high punt kicks, snap shots for goal and clever manoeuvres which comprise Australia’s national sport.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gil Brealey, Roland Beckett, Australian National Football Council and Melbourne Repertory Film Unit

results.title: Going Our Way
results.creator_credit: Chris Gallagher, Victorian Railways and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description: Presents the many employment opportunities in the Victorian Railways. A young boy playing with his toys, including a train, dreams of his future. He becomes a station assistant. Shows how he learns his job and benefits from the V.R.I. library and sporting clubs. Includes executive officers who started at the bottom and worked their way to the top.

results.title: Get out and live
results.brief_description:
This 1972 film, produced for the Main Roads Department, Brisbane, describes the establishment of an emergency control organisation within the department, and shows the training and implementation of an emergency evacuation of 1,500 people from the 14 storey office building.

Produced by Cameracraft Film Productions.

The colour is faded throughout the film and there are jumps in the soundtrack throughout due to missing frames.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Freedom river
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: A contemporary animated parable which examines the indifference that makes people blind to the injustices around them. Narrated by Orson Welles.

results.title: First aid
results.brief_description: A film of historic interest: an official training film produced for the War department in three parts. Part 1: emergency treatment of bleeding wounds, including self-administration. Covers the arterial system, pressure points and application of tournequets. Part 2: emergency treatment of broken bones. Part 3: covers methods of removing the wounded.
